interface.start-screen.mobile.label-star:
Obsidian stores notes on your device, so you can access them quickly and privately, even offline.
Your data is stored in a secure local folder called a **vault**.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-sync: To access your notes on other devices you need to set up sync.

Because Obsidian stores your notes on your devices, you'll need to set up sync if you want to access your notes on another phone or computer.
You can set up sync now, or just start writing and set it up later.
Create a synced vault on your Obsidian account so that you can access your data from other devices.
interface.start-screen.mobile.option-enc: Offers the strongest security but requires you to safely store your encryption password
Uses a key managed by Obsidian to protect your data in transit and on our servers.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-sync: Do you want to exclude any folders or files when syncing to this device?
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-sign: Create an Obsidian account or sign in
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-remo: Do you want to create a new vault or connect to an existing synced vault?
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-vaul: Your new vault will be placed in {{vaultLocation}}
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-regi: Choose a server region near you to make syncing faster.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-encr: This password cannot be changed later. If you forget your password, any remote data on Sync servers will be inaccessible forever.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-remo: Your account **{{email}}** has existing vaults you can connect to.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-sign: Sign in to your Obsidian account
interface.start-screen.mobile.msg-passwo: We have sent an email to {{email}} to reset your password.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-sync: Choose how to sync your notes
To use Obsidian on your devices you will need to sync your data.
Seamless across every device and OS.
Secured with the strongest end-to-end encryption standard.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-thir: May not be encrypted by default.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-sync:
Obsidian officially supports two syncing methods: **Obsidian Sync** and **iCloud**.
However, because Obsidian gives you control over your data there are other sync options you can use.
These options include third-party plugins and other tools which may require more advanced set up.
To use an alternate syncing method, **create a vault** and follow the instructions provided by the plugin or third-party sync provider.
interface.start-screen.mobile.label-emai: Your email is required to create an Obsidian account.
interface.start-screen.mobile.email-veri: You should receive an email shortly to **{{email}}** with instructions to connect to Obsidian Sync.
interface.start-screen.mobile.icloud-mis: Your iCloud vault was not detected. This could be due to any of the following reasons:
Your vault is on a different iCloud account than the one you are currently signed into on this device.
Your vault is not stored on the top-level Obsidian folder of your iCloud Drive.
interface.start-screen.mobile.i-cloud-un: iCloud syncing is only available on Apple devices. If your vault is currently syncing via iCloud, learn how to migrate your vault to a different sync service.
interface.start-screen.mobile.msg-invali: Vault location must be a folder.
interface.mobile.feedback.label-feedback: Are you enjoying Obsidian? Help us by giving it a rating.
